englishNarrator: Abdullah bin 'Umar (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: I saw that when Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) came to Mecca and kissed the Black Stone, (in the first circumambulation) he moved quickly in three circuits out of seven circuits.

englishNarrator: Nafi' reported on the authority of Ibn Umar (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ):
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) walked swiftly from stone to stone in three circuits and walked (normally) in four.

englishNarrator: Nafi' reported:
hadithEnglish: Ibn Umar (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) walked swiftly from stone to stone, and stated that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ) did like this.

englishNarrator: jabir bin Abdullah (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہما) reported:
hadithEnglish: I saw Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) walking swiftly from the Black Stone till he completed three circuits up to it.

englishNarrator: Jabir bin Abdullah (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) walked swiftly in three circuits from stone to stone.

englishNarrator: Abu Tufail رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: I said to Ibn `Abbas ( رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ): Do you think that walking swiftly round the House in three circuits, and just walking in four circuits is the Sunnah (of the Holy Prophet), for your people say that it is Sunnah? Thereupon he (Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) said: They have told the truth and the lie (too). I said: What do your words They have told the truth and the lie (too) imply? Thereupon he said: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) came to Mecca and the polytheists said that Muhammad and his Companions had emaciated and would, therefore, be unable to circumambulate the House; and they felt jealous of him (the Holy Prophet). (It was due to this) that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) commanded them to walk swiftly in three (circuits) and walk (normally) in four. I said to him: Inform me if it is Sunnah to observe Tawaf between al-Safa and al-Marwa while riding, for your people look upon it as Sunnah. He (Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) said: They have told the truth and the lie too. I said: What do your words They have told the truth and the lie too imply? He said: When Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) had come to Mecca, there was such a large gathering of people around him that even the virgins had come out of their houses (to catch a glimpse of his face). And they were saying: He is Muhammad; He is Muhammad. Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) (was so gentle and kind) that the people were not beaten back (to make way) in front of him. When there was a throng (of people) around him, he rode (the she-camel). However, walking and trotting are better.

englishNarrator: This hadith has been narrated on the authority of jurairi with the same chain of transmitters but with a slight variation of words (and this is):
hadithEnglish: He (the narrator) did not say: They felt jealous of him. but said: The people of Mecca, were jealous people.

englishNarrator: Abu Tufail رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: I said to Ibn 'Abbas (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ): People are of the view that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) moved quickly round the House and between al-Safa and al-Marwa, and (thus) it is Sunnah. He said: They told the truth and they told the lie.

englishNarrator: Abu Tufail رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: AI. said to Ibn 'Abbas ( رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ): I think that I saw Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ). He (Ibn 'Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) said' Give a description of him to me. I said: I saw him near al-Marwa on the back of a she- camel, and people had thronged around him. Thereupon Ibn'Abbas said رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ : It was Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) for they (the Compainions of the Holy Prophet) were neither pushed aside from him, nor were they turned away.

englishNarrator: Ibn 'Abbas ( رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) and his Companions came to Mecca and the fever in Medina had weakened them. Thereupon the polytheists (of Mecca) said: There would come to you a people whom the fever has made weak and they have suffered severely from it. They sat in Hatim. Thereupon Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) commanded them to walk quickly if three circuits and walk (in four) between the two corners. so that the polytheists should. see their endurance. The polytheists then said (to one another You were under the impression that fever had emaciated them. whereas they are stronger than so and so. Ibn Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ said: He (the Holy Prophet) did not command them (the Muslims) to walk quickly in all the circuits out of kindness to them.

englishNarrator: Ibn Abbas (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah 's Messenger (ﷺ) observed Sa'i and walked quickly round the House with a view to showing his strength to the polytheists.

englishNarrator: Abdullah bin Umar (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: He had not seen Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) touching anything in the House, except the two Yamani corners.

englishNarrator: Salim reported on the authority of his father:
hadithEnglish: Allah'& Messenger (ﷺ) did not touch any of the corners of the House. Except that of Black Corner (in which the Black Stone is embedded and that (portion) near it, towards the houses of the tribe of jumuhi.

englishNarrator: Nafi' reported on the authority of 'Abdullah (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ):
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) did not touch but the Stone and the Yamani corner.

englishNarrator: Ibn 'Umar (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: I have not abandoned touching of Yamani corners (and kissing of) the Stone since I saw Allah's messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) touching them both In hardship and ease.

englishNarrator: Nafi' reported:
hadithEnglish: I saw 'lbn 'Umar ( رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) touching the Stone with his hand and then kissing his hand. and he said: I have never abandoned it since I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) doing It.

englishNarrator: Ibn 'Abbas ( رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) is reported to have said:
hadithEnglish: He did not see Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) touching other than the Yamani corners.

englishNarrator: Salim narrated on the authority of his father (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ):
hadithEnglish: 'Umar bin al-Khattib (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) kissed (the Black Stone) and then said: By Allah, I know that you are a stone and if I were not to see Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) kissing you, I would not have kissed you. Harun said in his narration: A hadith like this has been transmitted to me by Zaid bin Aslam on the authority of his father Aslam.

englishNarrator: Ibn 'Umar (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Umar (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) kissed the Stone and said: I am kissing you, whereas I know that you are a stone, but I saw Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) kissing you (that Is why I kiss you).

englishNarrator: Abdullah bin Sarjis reported:
hadithEnglish: I saw the bald one, i.e. 'Umar bin Khattib (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ). kissing the Stone and saying: By Allah. I am kissing with full consciousness of the fact that you are a stone and that you can neither do any harm nor good; and if I had not seen Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) kissing you. I would not have kissed you. The rest of the hadith is the same.

englishNarrator: Abis bin Rabi'a reported:
hadithEnglish: I saw 'Umar (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) kissing the Stone and saying: I am kissing you and I know that you are a stone. And if I had not seen Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) kissing you, I would not have kissed you.

englishNarrator: Suwaid bin Ghafala reported:
hadithEnglish: I saw Umar (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) kissing the Stone and clinging to it and saying: I saw Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) having great love for you.

englishNarrator: Abdur Rahman narrated from Sufyan with his chain (a Hadith to no. 3071). He said:
hadithEnglish: "But I saw Abu Al-Qasim showing great interest in you, " and he did not mention clinging to it.

englishNarrator: Ibn 'Abbas (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) circumambulated the House on the occasion of the Farewell Pilgrimage on the back of his camel and touched the Corner (of Black Stone) with a stick.

englishNarrator: Jabir (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) circumambulated the House on the back of his riding camel on the occasion of the Farewell Pilgrimage and touched the Stone with his stick so that the people should see him, and he should be conspicuous, and they should be able to ask him (questions pertaining to religion) as the people had crowded round him.
